intro: Onosma brachysolen, commonly known as the narrow-flowered onosma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are often lance-shaped with a rough texture. Onosma brachysolen is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
